definitions.definition: put (things) in a neat, attractive, or required order.
examples: she had just finished arranging the flowers

definitions.definition: organize or make plans for (a future event).
examples: they hoped to arrange a meeting
synonyms: agree "they hoped to arrange a meeting"

definitions.definition: reach agreement about an action or event in advance.
examples: I arranged with my boss to have the time off

definitions.definition: ensure that (something) is done or provided by organizing it in advance.
examples: accommodations can be arranged if required

definitions.definition: adapt (a composition) for performance with instruments or voices other than those originally specified.
examples: songs arranged for viola and piano
synonyms: instrument "he arranged the piece for a full orchestra"

examples: the quarrel, partly by the interference of the crown prince, was arranged
